page.title: 04Bondleigh Farm. Sheep
page.content: {Flocks average 70_200}in number and are mainly cross bred, ie. Mules - Blue faced Leicester x Swaledale; Mesham - Teeswater x Swaledale; 1/2 breed - Border Leicester x Cheviot, together with small numbers of Suffolk, Suffolk crosses, and traditional Devon breeds of Dartmoor, Longwool, Closewool and Exmoor. Sheep are bred for{meat production,}wool being of secondary importance.{Lambing takes place during period{January to } {April,}some farmers lambing their ewes in doors as in-wintering of sheep gains popularity in this area. {Shearing}is done by farmer or contract shearers during May/June.{Wool}is sold to and graded by Wool Marketing Board at North Tawton.{Dipping,}compulsary to eradicate sheep scab is carried out twice a year. Sheep are submerged for one minute to ensure saturation.
